oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white two-sided propaganda leaflet conveys front image of Viet-Cong burning and pillaging a village with victims scattered about and, on the reverse, an image of American soldiers visiting the burned remains of the village and distributing medical supplies. The back also contains the leaflet number (246-078).

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Chieu Hoi (Open Arms) program represents a 10-year psychological operation launched by the South Vietnamese government in April of 1963 to encourage the "return" or "rally" of Viet-Cong, North Vietnamese Army soldiers, and Communist sympathizers. American involvement later came to dominate this pacification program. Leaflets, loudspeakers, radio, film, newspapers, display items, rallies and performances, publications, and other media were all employed in the effort.
